metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11612 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ZlibDecoders in Netty 4.1.x before 4.1.46 allow for unbounded memory allocation while decoding a ZlibEncoded byte stream. An attacker could send a large ZlibEncoded byte stream to the Netty server, forcing the server to allocate all of its free memory to a single decoder.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.7-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.7-4ubuntu0.1').
